mn60:8.1.pli: Santaṁyeva pana paraṁ lokaṁ ‘natthi paro loko’ tissa diṭṭhi hoti; sāssa hoti micchādiṭṭhi.
mn60:8.1.en: Moreover, since there actually is another world, their view that there is no other world is wrong view.

mn60:8.2.pli: Santaṁyeva kho pana paraṁ lokaṁ ‘natthi paro loko’ti saṅkappeti; svāssa hoti micchāsaṅkappo.
mn60:8.2.en: Since there actually is another world, their thought that there is no other world is wrong thought.

mn60:8.3.pli: Santaṁyeva kho pana paraṁ lokaṁ ‘natthi paro loko’ti vācaṁ bhāsati; sāssa hoti micchāvācā.
mn60:8.3.en: Since there actually is another world, their speech that there is no other world is wrong speech.

mn60:8.4.pli: Santaṁyeva kho pana paraṁ lokaṁ ‘natthi paro loko’ti āha; ye te arahanto paralokaviduno tesamayaṁ paccanīkaṁ karoti.
mn60:8.4.en: Since there actually is another world, in saying that there is no other world they contradict those perfected ones who know the other world.

mn60:8.5.pli: Santaṁyeva kho pana paraṁ lokaṁ ‘natthi paro loko’ti paraṁ saññāpeti; sāssa hoti asaddhammasaññatti.
mn60:8.5.en: Since there actually is another world, in convincing another that there is no other world they are convincing them to accept an untrue teaching.

mn60:11.1.pli: Santaṁyeva kho pana paraṁ lokaṁ ‘atthi paro loko’ tissa diṭṭhi hoti; sāssa hoti sammādiṭṭhi.
mn60:11.1.en: Moreover, since there actually is another world, their view that there is another world is right view.

mn60:11.2.pli: Santaṁyeva kho pana paraṁ lokaṁ ‘atthi paro loko’ti saṅkappeti; svāssa hoti sammāsaṅkappo.
mn60:11.2.en: Since there actually is another world, their thought that there is another world is right thought.

mn60:11.3.pli: Santaṁyeva kho pana paraṁ lokaṁ ‘atthi paro loko’ti vācaṁ bhāsati; sāssa hoti sammāvācā.
mn60:11.3.en: Since there actually is another world, their speech that there is another world is right speech.

mn60:11.4.pli: Santaṁyeva kho pana paraṁ lokaṁ ‘atthi paro loko’ti āha; ye te arahanto paralokaviduno tesamayaṁ na paccanīkaṁ karoti.
mn60:11.4.en: Since there actually is another world, in saying that there is another world they don’t contradict those perfected ones who know the other world.

mn60:11.5.pli: Santaṁyeva kho pana paraṁ lokaṁ ‘atthi paro loko’ti paraṁ saññāpeti; sāssa hoti saddhammasaññatti.
mn60:11.5.en: Since there actually is another world, in convincing another that there is another world they are convincing them to accept a true teaching.

mn60:16.1.pli: Santaṁyeva kho pana kiriyaṁ ‘natthi kiriyā’ tissa diṭṭhi hoti; sāssa hoti micchādiṭṭhi.
mn60:16.1.en: Moreover, since action actually does have an effect, their view that action is ineffective is wrong view.

mn60:16.2.pli: Santaṁyeva kho pana kiriyaṁ ‘natthi kiriyā’ti saṅkappeti; svāssa hoti micchāsaṅkappo.
mn60:16.2.en: Since action actually does have an effect, their thought that action is ineffective is wrong thought.

mn60:16.3.pli: Santaṁyeva kho pana kiriyaṁ ‘natthi kiriyā’ti vācaṁ bhāsati; sāssa hoti micchāvācā.
mn60:16.3.en: Since action actually does have an effect, their speech that action is ineffective is wrong speech.

mn60:16.4.pli: Santaṁyeva kho pana kiriyaṁ ‘natthi kiriyā’ti āha, ye te arahanto kiriyavādā tesamayaṁ paccanīkaṁ karoti.
mn60:16.4.en: Since action actually does have an effect, in saying that action is ineffective they contradict those perfected ones who teach that action is effective.

mn60:16.5.pli: Santaṁyeva kho pana kiriyaṁ ‘natthi kiriyā’ti paraṁ saññāpeti; sāssa hoti asaddhammasaññatti.
mn60:16.5.en: Since action actually does have an effect, in convincing another that action is ineffective they are convincing them to accept an untrue teaching.

mn60:19.1.pli: Santaṁyeva kho pana kiriyaṁ ‘atthi kiriyā’ tissa diṭṭhi hoti; sāssa hoti sammādiṭṭhi.
mn60:19.1.en: Moreover, since action actually does have an effect, their view that action is effective is right view.

mn60:19.2.pli: Santaṁyeva kho pana kiriyaṁ ‘atthi kiriyā’ti saṅkappeti; svāssa hoti sammāsaṅkappo.
mn60:19.2.en: Since action actually does have an effect, their thought that action is effective is right thought.

mn60:19.3.pli: Santaṁyeva kho pana kiriyaṁ ‘atthi kiriyā’ti vācaṁ bhāsati; sāssa hoti sammāvācā.
mn60:19.3.en: Since action actually does have an effect, their speech that action is effective is right speech.

mn60:19.4.pli: Santaṁyeva kho pana kiriyaṁ ‘atthi kiriyā’ti āha; ye te arahanto kiriyavādā tesamayaṁ na paccanīkaṁ karoti.
mn60:19.4.en: Since action actually does have an effect, in saying that action is effective they don’t contradict those perfected ones who teach that action is effective.

mn60:19.5.pli: Santaṁyeva kho pana kiriyaṁ ‘atthi kiriyā’ti paraṁ saññāpeti; sāssa hoti saddhammasaññatti.
mn60:19.5.en: Since action actually does have an effect, in convincing another that action is effective they are convincing them to accept a true teaching.

mn60:24.1.pli: Santaṁyeva kho pana hetuṁ ‘natthi hetū’ tissa diṭṭhi hoti; sāssa hoti micchādiṭṭhi.
mn60:24.1.en: Moreover, since there actually is causality, their view that there is no causality is wrong view.

mn60:24.2.pli: Santaṁyeva kho pana hetuṁ ‘natthi hetū’ti saṅkappeti; svāssa hoti micchāsaṅkappo.
mn60:24.2.en: Since there actually is causality, their thought that there is no causality is wrong thought.

mn60:24.3.pli: Santaṁyeva kho pana hetuṁ ‘natthi hetū’ti vācaṁ bhāsati; sāssa hoti micchāvācā.
mn60:24.3.en: Since there actually is causality, their speech that there is no causality is wrong speech.

mn60:24.4.pli: Santaṁyeva kho pana hetuṁ ‘natthi hetū’ti āha; ye te arahanto hetuvādā tesamayaṁ paccanīkaṁ karoti.
mn60:24.4.en: Since there actually is causality, in saying that there is no causality they contradict those perfected ones who teach that there is causality.

mn60:24.5.pli: Santaṁyeva kho pana hetuṁ ‘natthi hetū’ti paraṁ saññāpeti; sāssa hoti asaddhammasaññatti.
mn60:24.5.en: Since there actually is causality, in convincing another that there is no causality they are convincing them to accept an untrue teaching.

mn60:27.1.pli: Santaṁyeva kho pana hetuṁ ‘atthi hetū’ tissa diṭṭhi hoti; sāssa hoti sammādiṭṭhi.
mn60:27.1.en: Moreover, since there actually is causality, their view that there is causality is right view.

mn60:27.2.pli: Santaṁyeva kho pana hetuṁ ‘atthi hetū’ti saṅkappeti; svāssa hoti sammāsaṅkappo.
mn60:27.2.en: Since there actually is causality, their thought that there is causality is right thought.

mn60:27.3.pli: Santaṁyeva kho pana hetuṁ ‘atthi hetū’ti vācaṁ bhāsati; sāssa hoti sammāvācā.
mn60:27.3.en: Since there actually is causality, their speech that there is causality is right speech.

mn60:27.4.pli: Santaṁyeva kho pana hetuṁ ‘atthi hetū’ti āha, ye te arahanto hetuvādā tesamayaṁ na paccanīkaṁ karoti.
mn60:27.4.en: Since there actually is causality, in saying that there is causality they don’t contradict those perfected ones who teach that there is causality.

mn60:27.5.pli: Santaṁyeva kho pana hetuṁ ‘atthi hetū’ti paraṁ saññāpeti; sāssa hoti saddhammasaññatti.
mn60:27.5.en: Since there actually is causality, in convincing another that there is causality they are convincing them to accept a true teaching.

an9.37:2.3.pli: Tadeva nāma cakkhuṁ bhavissati te rūpā tañcāyatanaṁ no paṭisaṁvedissati.
an9.37:2.3.en: The eye itself is actually present, and so are those sights. Yet one will not experience that sense-field.

an9.37:2.4.pli: Tadeva nāma sotaṁ bhavissati te saddā tañcāyatanaṁ no paṭisaṁvedissati.
an9.37:2.4.en: The ear itself is actually present, and so are those sounds. Yet one will not experience that sense-field.

an9.37:2.5.pli: Tadeva nāma ghānaṁ bhavissati te gandhā tañcāyatanaṁ no paṭisaṁvedissati.
an9.37:2.5.en: The nose itself is actually present, and so are those smells. Yet one will not experience that sense-field.

an9.37:2.6.pli: Sāva nāma jivhā bhavissati te rasā tañcāyatanaṁ no paṭisaṁvedissati.
an9.37:2.6.en: The tongue itself is actually present, and so are those tastes. Yet one will not experience that sense-field.

an9.37:2.7.pli: Sova nāma kāyo bhavissati te phoṭṭhabbā tañcāyatanaṁ no paṭisaṁvedissatī”ti.
an9.37:2.7.en: The body itself is actually present, and so are those touches. Yet one will not experience that sense-field.”

an9.37:3.2.pli: “saññīmeva nu kho, āvuso ānanda, tadāyatanaṁ no paṭisaṁvedeti udāhu asaññī”ti?
an9.37:3.2.en: “Reverend Ānanda, is one who doesn’t experience that sense-field actually percipient or not?”

an9.37:3.3.pli: “Saññīmeva kho, āvuso, tadāyatanaṁ no paṭisaṁvedeti, no asaññī”ti.
an9.37:3.3.en: “Reverend, one who doesn’t experience that sense-field is actually percipient, not non-percipient.”

mlDocs.title:
Numbered Discourses 9
4. The Great Chapter
37. By Ānanda

mn54:25.6.pli: Mayañhi, bhante, pubbe aññatitthiye paribbājake anājānīyeva samāne ājānīyāti amaññimha, anājānīyeva samāne ājānīyabhojanaṁ bhojimha, anājānīyeva samāne ājānīyaṭhāne ṭhapimha;
mn54:25.6.en: Sir, I used to think that the wanderers following other paths were thoroughbreds, and I fed them and treated them accordingly, but they were not actually thoroughbreds.

mn54:25.7.pli: bhikkhū pana mayaṁ, bhante, ājānīyeva samāne anājānīyāti amaññimha, ājānīyeva samāne anājānīyabhojanaṁ bhojimha, ājānīyeva samāne anājānīyaṭhāne ṭhapimha;
mn54:25.7.en: I thought that the mendicants were not thoroughbreds, and I fed them and treated them accordingly, but they actually were thoroughbreds.

mn54:25.8.pli: idāni pana mayaṁ, bhante, aññatitthiye paribbājake anājānīyeva samāne anājānīyāti jānissāma, anājānīyeva samāne anājānīyabhojanaṁ bhojessāma, anājānīyeva samāne anājānīyaṭhāne ṭhapessāma.
mn54:25.8.en: But now I shall understand that the wanderers following other paths are not actually thoroughbreds, and I will feed them and treat them accordingly.

mn54:25.9.pli: Bhikkhū pana mayaṁ, bhante, ājānīyeva samāne ājānīyāti jānissāma, ājānīyeva samāne ājānīyabhojanaṁ bhojessāma, ājānīyeva samāne ājānīyaṭhāne ṭhapessāma.
mn54:25.9.en: And I shall understand that the mendicants actually are thoroughbreds, and I will feed them and treat them accordingly.

mlDocs.title:
Middle Discourses 54
With Potaliya the Householder

snp3.12:50.3.pli: Yaṁ, bhikkhave, sadevakassa lokassa samārakassa sabrahmakassa sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiyā pajāya sadevamanussāya idaṁ saccanti upanijjhāyitaṁ tadamariyānaṁ etaṁ musāti yathābhūtaṁ sammappaññāya sudiṭṭhaṁ, ayamekānupassanā.
snp3.12:50.3.en: ‘What this world—with its gods, Māras, and Brahmās, this population with its ascetics and brahmins, its gods and humans—focuses on as true, the noble ones have clearly seen with right wisdom to be actually false’: this is the first contemplation.

snp3.12:50.4.pli: Yaṁ, bhikkhave, sadevakassa …pe… sadevamanussāya idaṁ musāti upanijjhāyitaṁ, tadamariyānaṁ etaṁ saccanti yathābhūtaṁ sammappaññāya sudiṭṭhaṁ, ayaṁ dutiyānupassanā.
snp3.12:50.4.en: ‘What this world focuses on as false, the noble ones have clearly seen with right wisdom to be actually true’: this is the second contemplation.

snp3.12:54.4.pli: Yaṁ, bhikkhave, sadevakassa lokassa samārakassa sabrahmakassa sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiyā pajāya sadevamanussāya idaṁ sukhanti upanijjhāyitaṁ, tadamariyānaṁ etaṁ dukkhanti yathābhūtaṁ sammappaññāya sudiṭṭhaṁ, ayamekānupassanā.
snp3.12:54.4.en: ‘What this world—with its gods, Māras, and Brahmās, this population with its ascetics and brahmins, its gods and humans—focuses on as happiness, the noble ones have clearly seen with right wisdom to be actually suffering’: this is the first contemplation.

snp3.12:54.5.pli: Yaṁ, bhikkhave, sadevakassa …pe… sadevamanussāya idaṁ dukkhanti upanijjhāyitaṁ tadamariyānaṁ etaṁ sukhanti yathābhūtaṁ sammappaññāya sudiṭṭhaṁ, ayaṁ dutiyānupassanā.
snp3.12:54.5.en: ‘What this world focuses on as suffering, the noble ones have clearly seen with right wisdom to be actually happiness’: this is the second contemplation.

mn21:9.8.pli: Kiṁ nu kho me ayyā santaṁyeva nu kho ajjhattaṁ kopaṁ na pātukaroti udāhu asantaṁ
mn21:9.8.en: But does she actually have anger in her and just not show it? Or does she have no anger?

mn21:9.19.pli: ‘santaṁyeva kho me ayyā ajjhattaṁ kopaṁ na pātukaroti, no asantaṁ;
mn21:9.19.en: ‘My mistress actually has anger in her and just doesn’t show it; it’s not that she has no anger.

mn21:9.30.pli: ‘santaṁyeva kho me ayyā ajjhattaṁ kopaṁ na pātukaroti, no asantaṁ.
mn21:9.30.en: ‘My mistress actually has anger in her and just doesn’t show it; it’s not that she has no anger.

mlDocs.title:
Middle Discourses 21
The Simile of the Saw

an9.2:1.4.pli: “Saddhañce, bhikkhu, bhikkhu nissāya akusalaṁ pajahati kusalaṁ bhāveti, pahīnamevassa taṁ akusalaṁ hoti.
an9.2:1.4.en: “Mendicant, if a mendicant supported by faith gives up the unskillful and develops the skillful, the unskillful is actually given up by them.

an9.2:1.8.pli: paññañce, bhikkhu, bhikkhu nissāya akusalaṁ pajahati kusalaṁ bhāveti, pahīnamevassa taṁ akusalaṁ hoti.
an9.2:1.8.en: If a mendicant supported by wisdom gives up the unskillful and develops the skillful, the unskillful is actually given up by them.

mn75:15.14.pli: Asu ca, bho gotama, kuṭṭhī puriso arugatto pakkagatto kimīhi khajjamāno nakhehi vaṇamukhāni vippatacchamāno upahatindriyo dukkhasamphasseyeva aggismiṁ sukhamiti viparītasaññaṁ paccalatthā”ti.
mn75:15.14.en: That person was affected by leprosy, with sores and blisters on their limbs. Being devoured by worms, scratching with their nails at the opening of their wounds, their sense faculties were impaired. So even though the fire was actually painful to touch, they had a distorted perception that it was pleasant.”

mn75:16.2.pli: Ime ca, māgaṇḍiya, sattā kāmesu avītarāgā kāmataṇhāhi khajjamānā kāmapariḷāhena pariḍayhamānā upahatindriyā dukkhasamphassesuyeva kāmesu sukhamiti viparītasaññaṁ paccalatthuṁ.
mn75:16.2.en: These sentient beings who are not free from sensual pleasures—being consumed by craving for sensual pleasures, burning with passion for sensual pleasures—have impaired sense faculties. So even though sensual pleasures are actually painful to touch, they have a distorted perception that they are pleasant.

dn27:3.3.pli: “Taggha no, bhante, brāhmaṇā akkosanti paribhāsanti attarūpāya paribhāsāya paripuṇṇāya, no aparipuṇṇāyā”ti.
dn27:3.3.en: “Actually, sir, the brahmins do insult and abuse us with their typical insults to the fullest extent.”

dn27:4.1.pli: “Taggha vo, vāseṭṭha, brāhmaṇā porāṇaṁ assarantā evamāhaṁsu:
dn27:4.1.en: “Actually, Vāseṭṭha, the brahmins are forgetting their tradition when they say this to you.

sn6.4:3.3.pli: Yatra hi nāma aniccaṁyeva samānaṁ niccanti vakkhati, adhuvaṁyeva samānaṁ dhuvanti vakkhati, asassataṁyeva samānaṁ sassatanti vakkhati, akevalaṁyeva samānaṁ kevalanti vakkhati, cavanadhammaṁyeva samānaṁ acavanadhammanti vakkhati.
sn6.4:3.3.en: Because what is actually impermanent, not lasting, transient, incomplete, and perishable, he says is permanent, everlasting, eternal, complete, and imperishable.
